@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+[id='server_directory_structure-{context}']
+= {brandname} Server Filesystem
+{brandname} Server uses the following folders on the host filesystem under `{server_home}`:
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+├── bin
+├── boot
+├── docs
+├── lib
+├── server
+└── static
+----
+
+Besides resources in the `docs` folder, the only folder you need to interact with is the `server` folder.
+
+You can create multiple nodes under the same `{server_home}` directory, but each {brandname} Server instance must have its own `server` folder.
+For example, the filesystem for a cluster of 5 nodes could be as follows:
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+├── bin
+├── boot
+├── docs
+├── lib
+├── server
+├── server1
+├── server2
+├── server3
+├── server4
+└── static
+----
+

replies.bodyText: Actually, why isn't this README just part of the normal docs?
replies.author: ryanemerson

replies.bodyText:
@ryanemerson It's linked in the .Reference section rather than inline. I have put the link inline but I think that takes users away from the topic. You can see it the current docs here: https://infinispan.org/docs/stable/titles/server/server.html#downloading_server_distributions
Let me know what you think. If it's a better experience to go inline I'll change it.
replies.author: oraNod

replies.bodyText: README is in the server folder so it's easier for engineering to maintain and contribute to. Docs as code. Admittedly I could do a better job of pulling this into the Server Guide rather than linking to github.
